label: ham
subject: Re: License discussions in Debian (was: discussion with the FSF: GPLv3, GFDL, Nexenta)
body: 70 (return) [ The lively Fontenelle (Dialogues des Morts, xii.) affects to deride the vanity of human ambition, and seems to triumph in the disappointment of Constantine, whose immortal name is now lost in the vulgar appellation of Istambol, a Turkish corruption of. Yet the original name is still preserved, 1. By the nations of Europe. 2. By the modern Greeks. 3. By the Arabs, whose writings are diffused over the wide extent of their conquests in Asia and Africa. See DÕHerbelot, Bibliothque Orientale, p. 275. 4. By the more learned Turks, and by the emperor himself in his public mandates CantemirÕs History of the Othman Empire, p. 51.]
